titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Meusel (Harry H. ) papers
Guide to the Harry H. Meusel papers M2191
titlestmt.author: Malgorzata Schaefer

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This is a listing of materials rather than a true finding aid.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-04-13 13:10:02 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

physdesc.extent: one binder, rehoused in a half mb

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of Harry Meusel's letters home to his parents and siblings while serving as a hospital steward in the Philippines during the Spanish American War and subsequent conflict with Philippine insurgents. The letters are accompanied by photographs of his voyage to Manila aboard the U.S.S. Sherman transport ship, camp views and images of the men of the 3rd U.S. Infantry in the Philippines, and a cabinet photo of Meusel in his dress whites taken in Manila. Also included with one of the letters are several small fabric samples.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-pub lish.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Harry H. Meusel papers (M2191). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California.

did.unittitle: Letters address to mother and all, sister and all, brother Norbert and all
Letter to Ma from ?, with dress fabric samples

Photographs: 17 small snapshots illustrating Harry's voyage aboard the U.S.S. Sherman transport ship to Port Said, Singapore and Manila; 12 photographs depicting American troops in the Philippines; one cabinet card of Harry in his dress whites.
